info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 2:57PM EDT until July 12 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Miami FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southwest Florida, including the following county, Collier.
* WHEN...Until 600 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 256 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to nearly stationary thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen during the last hour or so. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area during the next couple of hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. If the rainfall amounts increase more than forecast, then a Flash Flood Warning maybe needed for this area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Naples, Golden Gate Estates, Golden Gate, West Toll Gate On Alligator Alley, Vineyards, Lely Resort, Naples Manor, East Naples, North Naples, Belle Meade, Orangetree, Naples Park, Lely, Quail Creek Estate, Intersection I-75 And Everglades Blvd and Pelican Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EDT THIS EVENING
